channel.title: How do you.. ( Better Explained)
channel.description:
Alright, when you log onto the server, the guide says hello to you. I don't know where to change what he says to you though. If it's under NPC's, or java's, not sure.
But when you first log in, this is what it says :[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/vy13wx.jpg[/img]

item.title: How do you.. ( Better Explained)
item.dc:creator: @Rickpwns Rickpwns
item.description:
@Rickpwns wrote:

Which one is the item ID, lol.

Here is the code again :

if(i == 8002)
{
class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5];
class8.aStringArray189[1] = “Wield”;
class8.aString170 = “Dragon claws”;
class8.aByteArray178 = “A set of fighting claws.”.getBytes();
class8.anInt174 = 13699;
class8.anInt181 = 630;
class8.anInt190 = 268;
class8.anInt198 = 1340;
class8.anInt204 = 0;
class8.anInt169 = -7;
class8.anInt194 = -13;
class8.anInt165 = 13698;
class8.anInt200 = 13698;
class8.anInt188 = -1;
class8.anInt164 = -1;
class8.anInt175 = -1;
class8.anInt197 = -1;
}

item.title: How do you.. ( Better Explained)
item.dc:creator: @Rickpwns Rickpwns
item.description:
@Rickpwns wrote:

o.O O.o:

Mask another item… Class8 I think?

I’m glad you’re helping me, but I’m kind of new to all this kinda stuff. How do you ‘mask’ an item?
And under the client right? Now the source.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 16, 2009, 06:21:23 pm[/size]
Well, I looked in Class8, and found Dragon Claws, now what do I do with it, to get em on my server, or the ID for them or whatever… Here is the code.

; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.aString170 = "Dragon claws"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes(); class8.anInt174 = 13699; class8.anInt181 = 630; class8.anInt190 = 268; class8.anInt198 = 1340; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -7; class8.anInt194 = -13; class8.anInt165 = 13698; class8.anInt200 = 13698; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; }

item.title: How do you.. ( Better Explained)
item.dc:creator: @Rickpwns Rickpwns
item.description:
@Rickpwns wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:8, topic:278726”][quote author=labeeb link=topic=367903.msg2786502#msg2786502 date=1242512461]
umm there is but it depends on the source.

so what u can do is go to ur source>item.cgf file> look for “dragon Claws”

or go to ur client>items list, and find dragon claws.

then do ::pickup (dragonclaw id) (1)- ammount
[/quote]

Actually, dragon claws would most likely be a masked item, so it’d depend on the client being used (its cache).[/quote]
How can I add Claws?

Read full topic

item.title: How do you.. ( Better Explained)
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

[quote=“labeeb, post:6, topic:278726”]umm there is but it depends on the source.

so what u can do is go to ur source>item.cgf file> look for “dragon Claws”

or go to ur client>items list, and find dragon claws.

then do ::pickup (dragonclaw id) (1)- ammount[/quote]

Actually, dragon claws would most likely be a masked item, so it’d depend on the client being used (its cache).

Read full topic

item.title: How do you.. ( Better Explained)
item.dc:creator: @Rickpwns Rickpwns
item.description:
@Rickpwns wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: How do you.. ( Better Explained)
item.dc:creator: @labeeb labeeb
item.description:
@labeeb wrote:

ok well to get claws u have to spawn them.

u cannot spawn them on a 317 server. only 508. unless u have a client with custom items.

Claws (rune claws) id is: 3101

so to spawn;

do: ::pickup 03101 1

3101 = id
1= ammount

enjoy!

Read full topic

item.title: How do you.. ( Better Explained)
item.dc:creator: @Rickpwns Rickpwns
item.description:
@Rickpwns wrote:

Nice, that worked, thank you very much.

Now, my other problem. How can I get claws? I’m Admin, and have no idea how to get them, lmao. How can I spawn them? Anyone know the id? Or is their a certain command, or what not?

Read full topic

item.title: How do you.. ( Better Explained)
item.dc:creator: @labeeb labeeb
item.description:
@labeeb wrote:

its in ur client.java file

search up the guides id, and itl show options,

its pretty self explanatory once u see the basic view on client.java

So go to client.java search up the id of lumbridge guide, which cud be 2244, and then change up the typing it says under it

Read full topic
